org.xlbean.converter

Interface ValueConverter<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BigDecimalValueConverter, BigIntegerValueConverter, BooleanValueConverter, ByteValueConverter, CharValueConverter, DateValueConverter, DelegateValueConverter, DoubleValueConverter, EnumValueConverter, FloatValueConverter, IntValueConverter, LocalDateTimeValueConverter, LocalDateValueConverter, LocalTimeValueCoverter, LongValueConverter, ShortValueConverter, StringValueConverter

    public interface ValueConverter<T>
    Converter used for converting String values in XlBean to object or vice-versa.

    This class defines all types which can be used as a leaf value and it can be checked by a method canConvert(Class). Any class which is not convertable is treated as custom object and dug down into the object to convert all the elements inside the object.

    See Also:
    DelegateValueConverter

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canConvert(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
      Returns true when the given clazz is convertable by this converter.
      T toObject(java.lang.String value, java.lang.Class<?> valueClass)
      Convert given value to an instance of valueClass.
      java.lang.String toString(java.lang.Object obj)
      Convert given obj to the String value to be hold in XlBean.

      • toObject

        T toObject(java.lang.String value,
           java.lang.Class<?> valueClass)
        Convert given value to an instance of valueClass.

        This method will not throw any exception even if the value is not able to be converted to the specified class. If the value is null, then always returns null.

        Parameters:
        value -
        valueClass -
        Returns:
